term.title: compensation effect

item.text: In a considerable number of cases plots of TΔ‡S vs. Δ‡H, for a series of reactions, e.g. for a reaction in a range of different solvents, are straight lines of approximately unit slope. Therefore, the terms Δ‡H and TΔ‡S in the expression partially compensate, and Δ‡G = Δ‡H - TΔ‡S or TΔ‡S separately.
